speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: SCENE I. Rome. A street.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Enter a company of mutinous Citizens, with staves, clubs, and other weapons

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Before we proceed any further, hear me speak.

speaker: All
text_entry: Speak, speak.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: You are all resolved rather to die than to famish?

speaker: All
text_entry: Resolved. resolved.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: First, you know Caius Marcius is chief enemy to the people.

speaker: All
text_entry: We know't, we know't.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Let us kill him, and we'll have corn at our own price.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Is't a verdict?

speaker: All
text_entry: No more talking on't; let it be done: away, away!

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: One word, good citizens.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: We are accounted poor citizens, the patricians good.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: What authority surfeits on would relieve us: if they

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: would yield us but the superfluity, while it were

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: wholesome, we might guess they relieved us humanely;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: but they think we are too dear: the leanness that

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: afflicts us, the object of our misery, is as an

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: inventory to particularise their abundance; our

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: sufferance is a gain to them Let us revenge this with

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: our pikes, ere we become rakes: for the gods know I

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: speak this in hunger for bread, not in thirst for revenge.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Would you proceed especially against Caius Marcius?

speaker: All
text_entry: Against him first: he's a very dog to the commonalty.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Consider you what services he has done for his country?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Very well; and could be content to give him good

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: report fort, but that he pays himself with being proud.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Nay, but speak not maliciously.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: I say unto you, what he hath done famously, he did

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: it to that end: though soft-conscienced men can be

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: content to say it was for his country he did it to

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: please his mother and to be partly proud; which he

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: is, even till the altitude of his virtue.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: What he cannot help in his nature, you account a

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: vice in him. You must in no way say he is covetous.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: If I must not, I need not be barren of accusations;

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: he hath faults, with surplus, to tire in repetition.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Shouts within

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: What shouts are these? The other side o' the city

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: is risen: why stay we prating here? to the Capitol!

speaker: All
text_entry: Come, come.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Soft! who comes here?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Enter MENENIUS AGRIPPA

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Worthy Menenius Agrippa; one that hath always loved

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: the people.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: He's one honest enough: would all the rest were so!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: What work's, my countrymen, in hand? where go you

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: With bats and clubs? The matter? speak, I pray you.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Our business is not unknown to the senate; they have

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: had inkling this fortnight what we intend to do,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: which now we'll show 'em in deeds. They say poor

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: suitors have strong breaths: they shall know we

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: have strong arms too.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Why, masters, my good friends, mine honest neighbours,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Will you undo yourselves?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: We cannot, sir, we are undone already.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I tell you, friends, most charitable care

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Have the patricians of you. For your wants,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Your suffering in this dearth, you may as well

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Strike at the heaven with your staves as lift them

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Against the Roman state, whose course will on

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The way it takes, cracking ten thousand curbs

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Of more strong link asunder than can ever

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Appear in your impediment. For the dearth,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The gods, not the patricians, make it, and

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Your knees to them, not arms, must help. Alack,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You are transported by calamity

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Thither where more attends you, and you slander

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The helms o' the state, who care for you like fathers,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: When you curse them as enemies.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Care for us! True, indeed! They ne'er cared for us

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: yet: suffer us to famish, and their store-houses

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: crammed with grain; make edicts for usury, to

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: support usurers; repeal daily any wholesome act

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: established against the rich, and provide more

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: piercing statutes daily, to chain up and restrain

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: the poor. If the wars eat us not up, they will; and

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: there's all the love they bear us.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Either you must

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Confess yourselves wondrous malicious,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Or be accused of folly. I shall tell you

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: A pretty tale: it may be you have heard it;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: But, since it serves my purpose, I will venture

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: To stale 't a little more.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Well, I'll hear it, sir: yet you must not think to

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: fob off our disgrace with a tale: but, an 't please

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: you, deliver.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: There was a time when all the body's members

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Rebell'd against the belly, thus accused it:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: That only like a gulf it did remain

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I' the midst o' the body, idle and unactive,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Still cupboarding the viand, never bearing

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Like labour with the rest, where the other instruments

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Did see and hear, devise, instruct, walk, feel,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And, mutually participate, did minister

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Unto the appetite and affection common

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Of the whole body. The belly answer'd--

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Well, sir, what answer made the belly?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Sir, I shall tell you. With a kind of smile,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Which ne'er came from the lungs, but even thus--

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: For, look you, I may make the belly smile

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: As well as speak--it tauntingly replied

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: To the discontented members, the mutinous parts

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: That envied his receipt; even so most fitly

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: As you malign our senators for that

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: They are not such as you.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Your belly's answer? What!

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: The kingly-crowned head, the vigilant eye,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: The counsellor heart, the arm our soldier,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Our steed the leg, the tongue our trumpeter.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: With other muniments and petty helps

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: In this our fabric, if that they--

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: What then?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: 'Fore me, this fellow speaks! What then? what then?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Should by the cormorant belly be restrain'd,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Who is the sink o' the body,--

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Well, what then?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: The former agents, if they did complain,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: What could the belly answer?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I will tell you

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: If you'll bestow a small--of what you have little--

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Patience awhile, you'll hear the belly's answer.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Ye're long about it.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Note me this, good friend;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Your most grave belly was deliberate,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Not rash like his accusers, and thus answer'd:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: 'True is it, my incorporate friends,' quoth he,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: 'That I receive the general food at first,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Which you do live upon; and fit it is,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Because I am the store-house and the shop

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Of the whole body: but, if you do remember,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I send it through the rivers of your blood,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Even to the court, the heart, to the seat o' the brain;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And, through the cranks and offices of man,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The strongest nerves and small inferior veins

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: From me receive that natural competency

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Whereby they live: and though that all at once,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You, my good friends,'--this says the belly, mark me,--

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Ay, sir; well, well.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: 'Though all at once cannot

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: See what I do deliver out to each,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Yet I can make my audit up, that all

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: From me do back receive the flour of all,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And leave me but the bran.' What say you to't?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: It was an answer: how apply you this?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The senators of Rome are this good belly,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And you the mutinous members; for examine

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Their counsels and their cares, digest things rightly

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Touching the weal o' the common, you shall find

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: No public benefit which you receive

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: But it proceeds or comes from them to you

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And no way from yourselves. What do you think,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You, the great toe of this assembly?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: I the great toe! why the great toe?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: For that, being one o' the lowest, basest, poorest,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Of this most wise rebellion, thou go'st foremost:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Thou rascal, that art worst in blood to run,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Lead'st first to win some vantage.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: But make you ready your stiff bats and clubs:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Rome and her rats are at the point of battle;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The one side must have bale.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Enter CAIUS MARCIUS

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Hail, noble Marcius!

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Thanks. What's the matter, you dissentious rogues,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: That, rubbing the poor itch of your opinion,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Make yourselves scabs?

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: We have ever your good word.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: He that will give good words to thee will flatter

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Beneath abhorring. What would you have, you curs,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: That like nor peace nor war? the one affrights you,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: The other makes you proud. He that trusts to you,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Where he should find you lions, finds you hares;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Where foxes, geese: you are no surer, no,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Than is the coal of fire upon the ice,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Or hailstone in the sun. Your virtue is

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: To make him worthy whose offence subdues him

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And curse that justice did it.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Who deserves greatness

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Deserves your hate; and your affections are

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: A sick man's appetite, who desires most that

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Which would increase his evil. He that depends

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Upon your favours swims with fins of lead

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And hews down oaks with rushes. Hang ye! Trust Ye?

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: With every minute you do change a mind,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And call him noble that was now your hate,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Him vile that was your garland. What's the matter,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: That in these several places of the city

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: You cry against the noble senate, who,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Under the gods, keep you in awe, which else

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Would feed on one another? What's their seeking?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: For corn at their own rates; whereof, they say,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The city is well stored.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Hang 'em! They say!

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: They'll sit by the fire, and presume to know

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: What's done i' the Capitol; who's like to rise,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Who thrives and who declines; side factions

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: and give out

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Conjectural marriages; making parties strong

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And feebling such as stand not in their liking

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Below their cobbled shoes. They say there's

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: grain enough!

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Would the nobility lay aside their ruth,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And let me use my sword, I'll make a quarry

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: With thousands of these quarter'd slaves, as high

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: As I could pick my lance.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Nay, these are almost thoroughly persuaded;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: For though abundantly they lack discretion,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Yet are they passing cowardly. But, I beseech you,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: What says the other troop?

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: They are dissolved: hang 'em!

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: They said they were an-hungry; sigh'd forth proverbs,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: That hunger broke stone walls, that dogs must eat,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: That meat was made for mouths, that the gods sent not

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Corn for the rich men only: with these shreds

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: They vented their complainings; which being answer'd,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And a petition granted them, a strange one--

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: To break the heart of generosity,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And make bold power look pale--they threw their caps

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: As they would hang them on the horns o' the moon,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Shouting their emulation.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: What is granted them?

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Five tribunes to defend their vulgar wisdoms,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Of their own choice: one's Junius Brutus,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Sicinius Velutus, and I know not--'Sdeath!

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: The rabble should have first unroof'd the city,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Ere so prevail'd with me: it will in time

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Win upon power and throw forth greater themes

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: For insurrection's arguing.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: This is strange.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Go, get you home, you fragments!

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Enter a Messenger, hastily

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Where's Caius Marcius?

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Here: what's the matter?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The news is, sir, the Volsces are in arms.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: I am glad on 't: then we shall ha' means to vent

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Our musty superfluity. See, our best elders.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Enter COMINIUS, TITUS LARTIUS, and other Senators; JUNIUS BRUTUS and SICINIUS VELUTUS

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Marcius, 'tis true that you have lately told us;

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: The Volsces are in arms.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: They have a leader,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Tullus Aufidius, that will put you to 't.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: I sin in envying his nobility,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And were I any thing but what I am,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: I would wish me only he.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: You have fought together.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Were half to half the world by the ears and he.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Upon my party, I'ld revolt to make

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Only my wars with him: he is a lion

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: That I am proud to hunt.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Then, worthy Marcius,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Attend upon Cominius to these wars.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: It is your former promise.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Sir, it is;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And I am constant. Titus Lartius, thou

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Shalt see me once more strike at Tullus' face.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: What, art thou stiff? stand'st out?

speaker: TITUS
text_entry: No, Caius Marcius;

speaker: TITUS
text_entry: I'll lean upon one crutch and fight with t'other,

speaker: TITUS
text_entry: Ere stay behind this business.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: O, true-bred!

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Your company to the Capitol; where, I know,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Our greatest friends attend us.

speaker: TITUS
text_entry: [To COMINIUS]                Lead you on.

speaker: TITUS
text_entry: To MARCIUS

speaker: TITUS
text_entry: Right worthy you priority.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Noble Marcius!

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: [To the Citizens]  Hence to your homes; be gone!

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Nay, let them follow:

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: The Volsces have much corn; take these rats thither

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: To gnaw their garners. Worshipful mutiners,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Your valour puts well forth: pray, follow.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Citizens steal away. Exeunt all but SICINIUS and BRUTUS

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Was ever man so proud as is this Marcius?

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: He has no equal.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: When we were chosen tribunes for the people,--

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Mark'd you his lip and eyes?

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Nay. but his taunts.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Being moved, he will not spare to gird the gods.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Be-mock the modest moon.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: The present wars devour him: he is grown

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Too proud to be so valiant.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Such a nature,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Tickled with good success, disdains the shadow

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Which he treads on at noon: but I do wonder

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: His insolence can brook to be commanded

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Under Cominius.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Fame, at the which he aims,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: In whom already he's well graced, can not

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Better be held nor more attain'd than by

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: A place below the first: for what miscarries

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Shall be the general's fault, though he perform

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: To the utmost of a man, and giddy censure

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Will then cry out of Marcius 'O if he

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Had borne the business!'

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Besides, if things go well,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Opinion that so sticks on Marcius shall

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Of his demerits rob Cominius.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Come:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Half all Cominius' honours are to Marcius.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Though Marcius earned them not, and all his faults

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: To Marcius shall be honours, though indeed

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: In aught he merit not.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Let's hence, and hear

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: How the dispatch is made, and in what fashion,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: More than his singularity, he goes

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Upon this present action.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Lets along.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Exeunt
